file_content.text: We've got the research station set up, and thanks to you, we should have those power cores installed soon.
I've recovered all the power cores. Here you go.
We can use these to help the Voss set up a geothermal monitoring station that will last for years. Thank you.
Mark my words: The Republic will gain more inroads with the Voss through technology than ideology.
They could be dangerous if used for other purposes than research.
Use the power cores wisely.
Rest assured, my colleagues and I are more interested in holding the planet together than splitting it apart.
It was nothing, really.
Your humility wouldn't serve you well in science--you should claim your achievements.
Because of you, we'll have a research station that brings people together, instead of driving them apart.
Your power cell technology could protect the Voss, if you used it to improve their weapons.
Armaments would be better.
I'm glad that not everyone thinks as you do. The beauty of science is that it can create as well as destroy.
Because of your efforts, we'll have the chance.
We'll be ready for those power cores soon, assuming you recover them before the Gormak wipe us out.
Ah, Master Jedi, welcome. We're still cleaning up after the latest raid.
And here comes the military, after everything of value has already been destroyed or stolen.
Welcome to what's left of our research station.
I could try and find you a chair, but I suspect the Gormak will be back sooner rather than later.
Not that I blame them--Gormak are like any other military culture, abusing science to make better bombs.
What would the Gormak want with your station?
Why would they attack here?
What does any military want? They want our advancements to make more powerful weapons.
Maybe I can help you.
We could use a hand; the Gormak smashed anything they didn't want to carry, and left plenty of casualties.
Technology keeps our enemies at bay.
Better bombs ensure peace.
I'd expect that response from a soldier, not that technology's done any good in keeping the Gormak away.
It's certainly cowed the Gormak into submission--wait, no it hasn't. It's done rather the opposite.
We brought in some experimental power cores--part of an effort to promote the Voss's science studies--but the Gormak stole them.
Now instead of being used for geothermal research, they'll be fueling some Gormak war machine.
I won't let the Gormak use them to threaten the Republic or Voss.
I'll get your cores back.
You'll want to hurry then--if they install those cores in a new warship, nothing will be able to protect Voss-Ka.
Can the cores be used as a weapon?
Tell me more about the cores.
Not on their own, no, but they can last for years, which makes them ideal for the Gormak.
Their war machine isn't a danger.
The Gormak aren't a threat.
You're a fool to underestimate them, especially while they're stealing our resources.
They're building a starship; these cores would give them a perfect energy source and enough power to obliterate Voss-Ka.
If you really want to help us, get those power cores back. The Republic didn't come here to start a war.
The Gormak can't have gone far. I should have your cores back soon.
I'll find your power cores.
Those cores could secure our alliance with the Voss. I'll find them.
Anything to build support.
Those cores are a threat as long as the Gormak have them. That won't be much longer.
Consider the mission done.
I'm glad you understand the urgency, thank you.
If nothing else, they'll be worth a fortune on the black market.
I'll find your gizmos for you.
The Republic will make it worth your while if you recover them.
I'll see if I find the time.
If that's the best I can hope for, I'll have to accept it.
The Gormak have been camping along the ridge. That's probably the best place to look for the raiders that attacked us.
When you've got all the power cores, please bring them back here. I'll see to it they're put to their proper use.
I don't have time to go looking for your research equipment, but I wish you luck.
I'm sorry. [Refuse quest]
Luck won't save any of us if the Gormak can bomb targets with impunity.
Sorry, but the Gormak left us quite a mess to clean up. I've got to take inventory and see what we've got left.
